page.title: 07Middlezoy Parish Church
page.content: There has been some sort of church in Middlezoy since 971, but the present church was not built until about 1268 and there have been a number of additions since. The Dedication of the church is to the Holy Cross. The tower is a fine example of an early 15th Century Somerset tower. Just below the battlements 'Hunky Punks' can be seen. These are small carved figures (distinct from gargoyles which hold water spouts) and are only found in a small area of south and west Somerset. Middlezoy Parish Church is now part of a United Benefice with four other parishes and so shares a vicar with those parishes. In 1985 Canon John Tinsley retired and will be succeeded by Rev Martin George.
